data.description:
The Interaction SDK samples are the official reference for all interactions available in the Presence Platform Interaction SDK package. Interaction SDK is a library of modular, composable interaction components that makes it simpler, faster and easier for developers to build high-quality interactions in virtual or augmented reality. Start here along with First Hand to understand the possibilities of using Interaction SDK in your project. Consult the samples as a reference as you develop your own experience. Interactions shown in these samples include poke, hand grab, touch grab, ray, distance grab, post recognition, transformers, gestures and use grab.

Interested in using Interaction SDK in your Unity project? You can learn more about Interaction SDK and get started by visiting the Overview page.

changelog.change_log:
New sample scenes added!
  * Comprehensive Rig
      * Demonstrates a camera rig containing all possible interactors for quick interaction prototyping
  * Concurrent Hands and Controllers
      * Demonstrates how to handle interactions between a combination of hands and controllers
  * Panel with Manipulators
      * Demonstrates several sample interactables with manipulators attached

UPDATE: Initial build of this version had a permissions issue which caused it to lock up for some on launch which has been resolved.

Updated to ISDK v55 with new scenes for Locomotion and Snap interactions.
